articles.title: Losing fat mass, but not lean mass, key for heart health in obese patients with type 2 diabetes - Times Now
articles.description: Being overweight and obese are strong risk factors for both type 2 diabetes and heart disease, and patients are often counselled to lose weight to reduce the likelihood of developing both conditions.
articles.content:
Dallas: Reducing the level of body fat and waist size are linked to a lower risk of heart failure in patients with type 2 diabetes, a study led by UT Southwestern researchers indicates.

articles.description: London, Nov 10 (IANS) A new research adds to the growing body of evidence that severe Covid-19 infection appears rare in newborn babies.
